p: Rapid scale-up of early direct-acting antiviral (DAA) therapy for HCV is ongoing in many European and non-European countries [ 10, 11] as reimbursement restrictions are progressively relieved. Projections from mathematical models for several Western countries [ 12–15] and early surveillance data from The Netherlands and Switzerland support the claim that DAA scale-up may abate the high incidence of HCV in HIV-positive MSM [ 15–18].
